Hi John-

Thoroughly enjoying your course on Pluralsight called “JavaScript Build Automation With Gulp.js”. You have a gift for teaching.

Wanted to pass along an idea that I had (perhaps you have already thought of it).

The “Named vs Anonymous Functions” rule in your angular style guide (https://github.com/johnpapa/angular-styleguide#style-y024) applies quite nicely to gulpfile.js. In fact, it becomes much more readable, somewhat self documenting, and it’s easy to identify the gulp tasks in a single view:

=========================== gulp.task(‘clean’, cleanBuild);

gulp.task(‘clean-styles’, cleanStyles);

gulp.task(‘clean-fonts’, cleanFontsInBuild);

gulp.task(‘clean-images’, cleanImagesInBuild);

gulp.task(‘clean-code’, cleanCodeInBuild);

gulp.task(‘default’, [‘help’]);

gulp.task(‘fonts’, [‘clean-fonts’], moveFonts);

gulp.task(‘help’, $.taskListing);

////////// task implementations:

cleanBuild() { .. }

cleanStyles() { …. }

///etc

===========================

I learned a ton during your course. Thanks again and God bless.
